main event: Multiple witnesses observed glowing white and green lights maneuvering in the sky over Houma and New Orleans, Louisiana, on 14-15 September 1954.
interesting points: The observation lasted for three hours and included reports of the lights seeming to chase one another., Witnesses described the objects as erratic in course and emitting a possible loud popping sound., The sighting was evaluated as astronomical phenomena, including meteors or satellites., A state representative reported seeing a metallic object over Lake Pontchartrain during this period., The objects were observed at night by various civilians and military personnel in the area.
witness description: civilians including a state representative and local officials
